refnamediv.refpurpose: WebDyne module to flag pages as static and compile once to HTML

refsynopsisdiv.programlisting: # Sample time.psp compiled to static HTML. Every time this page is requested it will show # the same time # <start_html> This page was first loaded at <? localtime ?> __PERL__ use WebDyne::Static;

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: The WebDyne::Static module will flag that all dynamic components of a page should be run at compile time, and the resulting HTML saved as a static file which will be served on subsequent requests.
The WebDyne framework will monitor for changes in the source file and recompile to a new HTML if the source .psp file is updated.

listitem.para: Get or set the static attribute for this page. When setting the static attribute for a page it is only set for that instance of the page. To set a page as permanently static (except on source file update) use the WebDyne::Static module as per synopsis, or update the meta data via $self->meta->{'static'}=1;

refsection.title: OPTIONS
refsection.para: WebDyne::Static does not expose any options to the import function when called via use.
